citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
While the facility provides deworming and ectoparasite prevention for dogs on the premises, it does not provide
heartworm prevention as directed by the written program of veterinary care. Deviation from the program of veterinary care
may increase risk of heartworm exposure and disease. The facility must assure the veterinarian has appropriate authority
to ensure adequate care by adhering to the plan's requirements.
Correct by 7/18/24.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility has administered multiple medications and supplements that were out of date, including a deworming
medication with an expiration date of May, 2024 and a probiotic with an expiration date of June, 2023. The use of expired
medication is not considered standard of care and could lose potency and be less effective. This could cause animals
unnecessary harm or distress. The facility must correct this issue.
Correct by 7/5/24.

The facility does not currently maintain a written plan to provide dogs with the opportunity for exercise. While the dogs do
have access to sufficiently sized runs, maintaining written procedures helps ensure these needs are met for all dogs on
the premises. The facility must develop an exercise plan approved by the attending veterinarian.
Correct by July 25, 2024.
This is a continuation of the report for the routine inspection conducted 6/27/24 and contains the remaining non-
compliances found during the inspection. The exit briefing for the items included on this report was conducted on 6/27/24.
This inspection was conducted with the licensee on 6/27/24. The exit interview was conducted with the licensee on
6/27/24.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
While the facility provides deworming and ectoparasite prevention for dogs on the premises, it does not provide 
heartworm prevention as directed by the written program of veterinary care. Deviation from the program of veterinary care 
may increase risk of heartworm exposure and disease. The facility must assure the veterinarian has appropriate authority 
to ensure adequate care by adhering to the plan's requirements.  
 
Correct by 7/18/24. 
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility has administered multiple medications and supplements that were out of date, including a deworming 
medication with an expiration date of May, 2024 and a probiotic with an expiration date of June, 2023. The use of expired 
medication is not considered standard of care and could lose potency and be less effective. This could cause animals 
unnecessary harm or distress. The facility must correct this issue. 
 
Correct by 7/5/24. 
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
The facility does not currently maintain a written plan to provide dogs with the opportunity for exercise. While the dogs do 
have access to sufficiently sized runs, maintaining written procedures helps ensure these needs are met for all dogs on 
the premises. The facility must develop an exercise plan approved by the attending veterinarian. 
 
Correct by July 25, 2024. 
 
This is a continuation of the report for the routine inspection conducted 6/27/24 and contains the remaining non-
compliances found during the inspection. The exit briefing for the items included on this report was conducted on 6/27/24.

This inspection was conducted with the licensee on 6/27/24. The exit interview was conducted with the licensee on 
6/27/24. 
 
 n
